results.title: Concerto for ads and heads
results.brief_description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.

results.title: Con motto
results.brief_description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.

results.title: Comradeship
results.creator_credit: G Pabst, Aubert Film, Franco-Film, Gaumont and Nero-Film
results.brief_description: The dramatic story of a mining disaster shortly after World War I on the French-German border. Post war tension and bitterness are put aside when the German miners help rescue their French comrades. Emphasising worker solidarity. In German and French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: G Pabst, Aubert Film, Franco-Film, Gaumont and Nero-Film

results.title: Comrades: a Lanternist's account of the Tolpuddle Martyrs and what became of them
results.creator_credit: Bill Douglas, Simon Relph, Film Four International and Skresa Productions
results.brief_description: An itinerant Lanternist is witness to the rural unrest prevalent in Southern England in the early 1830’s. He arrives in the village of Tolpuddle where the farm labourers form a union and strike when their wages are reduced. Arrested and transported to Australia for seven years, the film follows the fortunes of the five men until their pardon and return to England. Bill Douglas’ only other major film after his autobiographical trilogy, is a similar homage to the oppressed poor. However, in spite of its subject matter, this is less grim. An important work from a great filmmaker. Cameo appearances from Vanessa Redgrave, James Fox, Michael Hordern, John Hargreaves and Robert Stephens.

results.title: Computers: The Friendly Invasion (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Extraordinary computer, graphics and spectacular scenes from the terrific Disney feature “Tron” illustrate dazzling computer applications and introduce students to a fabulous resource. You will learn how people working with computers, can build a better world in the future.

results.title: Computers in the seventies
results.brief_description: This film takes a pre-micro-chip look at computer development to the 1970s providing a short historical background and then examining contemporary computer development in meteorology, records storage, aviation and building design, and medical procedures. Touches on contemporary times with “suspicion”.

results.title: Computers in accounting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows some of the ways in which computer technology is being used in accounting firms and examines the impact of this on small business. Some of the problems encountered by small business when installing a new computer system are discussed. Also looks at the training needed by young people seeking employment in the accounting profession.
